summary:
• At Amgen, I serve as Clinical Pharmacology TA Head for Hematology Oncology & Clinical Pharmacology TA Head for Rare Disease & provide strategic & scientific leadership to Global Clinical Pharmacology Leads (team of direct reports including Principal Scientists, Asso. Directors, Directors, & Senior Directors) responsible for providing Clinical Pharmacology, Modeling and Simulation leadership to the global drug development teams for Hematology Oncology TA & Rare Disease TA. I also head a group of experts as direct reports in Mechanistic-PBPK Modeling & Simulation. I also serve on the Amgen, San Francisco site leadership as co-chair of Extended Leadership Team. 

• I have 19+ years of industry new drug development clinical pharmacology & pharmacometrics experience for both small molecule drugs & therapeutic proteins/innovative novel modalities across TAs of oncology, rare diseases, inflammation, & CV/Met from Amgen, Bristol-Myers Squibb, & Dr. Reddy's Laboratories. I have significant contributions to global filings & approvals of following marketed small molecule & therapeutic protein drugs across TAs: Saxagliptin (ONGLYZA®), Saxagliptin & Metformin IR & XR (KOMBOGLYZE® & KOMBIGLYZE XR®), Apixaban (ELIQUIS®), Carfilzomib (KYPROLIS®), & Blinatumomab (BLINCYTO®). 

• I received training as a pharmacist & earned my PhD from the University of Maryland in Pharmacokinetics/Pharmacodynamics & Biopharmaceutics. I serve on the Editorial Boards of the journal Clinical Pharmacology & Therapeutics (CPT), the Journal of Clinical Pharmacology (JCP), & the journal Clinical Pharmacokinetics (Clin Pharmacokin). I am an elected Regent (Board Member) of the American College of Clinical Pharmacology & a Fellow of the American College of Clinical Pharmacology (FCP). I am IQ Consortium Clinical Pharmacology Leadership Group Amgen representative & also serve as an Affiliate Assistant Professor at the University of Maryland School of Pharmacy & Industry Advisory Board Member of the Washington State University, College of Pharmacy Pharmaceutical Sciences. I have authored 50+ peer-reviewed scientific journal article publications & 55+ scientific abstracts/presentations in the field of clinical pharmacology & pharmacometrics.

message.text: We are growing our Mechanistic-PBPK/PD Modeling & Simulation Group. If you are looking to work with a great leader & an excellent mentor & manager: Dr. Annie Lumen. Annie Lumen is hiring and looking for an expert in the field of Mechanistic-PBPK/PD Modeling & Simulation. Please check out our this position & reach out to us. Cathy Freed Jessica Hacker Annie Lumen

ingestedContentSummary.description: Explore the details of a Principal Scientist, Clinical Pharmacology, Modeling & Simulation career in South San Francisco. Live. Win. Thrive. Search and apply for a rewarding new career at Amgen.
